message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.CL

The paper discusses a neural network model that demonstrates one-shot generalization to a new game, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The model also uses unsupervised comparison to discover which characteristics of the input are invariant, which is a common technique in machine learning and falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The model also uses oscillatory regularities in network firing to dynamically bind predicates to arguments, which is a technique commonly used in neural networks and falls under the category of neural networks (cs.NE). The model is trained on video game data, which falls under the category of computer vision (cs.CV). Finally, the paper discusses the need for models of human cognition to account for far-reaching and flexible generalization, which falls under the category of natural language processing and cognitive science (cs.CL).
